result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson in court with Defendant Larry J Wachter. Clerk: PU
 Minutes:  DE waives any conflict on proceeding before Judge Gabriele today.  State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Count 1 - Dismissed by the State.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; judgment is withheld and parties enter into a stipulated hold open agreement for 6 months.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 08:30 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Solstice Sanctuary, Angela A, Bryan L, Alissa L, Dr. Ashley S and may not possess any horses.

Br 3 notified of sched order.

Case heard with 22CF221 today.   Defendant, Larry J Wachter, appeared with Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:     ST called witness PPPD Ofc Sarai Anguiano; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Nordby and Johnson. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
